Author:- Mr. Ritesh Sharma

Heart health is a crucial aspect of overall well-being, and while modern medicine offers a range of treatments and preventive measures, many people are turning to alternative therapies for additional support. One such therapy is acupressure, an ancient healing practice rooted in Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM). This blog delves into the world of acupressure points for heart health, exploring how this technique can benefit your cardiovascular system.

What is Acupressure?

Acupressure involves applying pressure to specific points on the body to stimulate natural healing processes. It is based on the same principles as acupuncture, but instead of using needles, practitioners use their fingers, palms, elbows, or special tools to apply pressure. The goal is to balance the body’s energy flow, known as “Qi” (pronounced “chee”), which travels along pathways called meridians.

The Importance of Heart Health

The heart is a vital organ responsible for pumping blood throughout the body, supplying oxygen and nutrients to tissues, and removing carbon dioxide and other wastes. Maintaining heart health is essential to prevent cardiovascular diseases such as heart attacks, strokes, and hypertension.

Key Acupressure Points for Heart Health

Several acupressure points are believed to support heart health by promoting better circulation, reducing stress, and balancing the body’s energy. Here are some key acupressure points for heart health:

  1. Heart 7 (HT7) – Shenmen (Spirit Gate)
    • Location: On the wrist, at the crease, in line with the little finger.
    • Benefits: Known for calming the mind, reducing anxiety, and promoting emotional balance. It helps alleviate heart-related symptoms like palpitations and insomnia.
  2. Pericardium 6 (PC6) – Neiguan (Inner Pass)
    • Location: On the inner forearm, about three finger widths from the wrist crease.
    • Benefits: Effective for relieving chest pain, palpitations, and nausea. It also helps reduce stress and anxiety, which are significant contributors to heart disease.
  3. Ren 17 (CV17) – Shanzhong (Chest Center)
    • Location: In the center of the chest, at the level of the fourth rib.
    • Benefits: Known as the “Influential Point of Qi,” it helps regulate heart function, relieve chest congestion, and improve emotional well-being.
  4. Heart 3 (HT3) – Shaohai (Lesser Sea)
    • Location: On the inner side of the elbow, when the arm is bent.
    • Benefits: Helps clear heat from the heart, calm the mind, and alleviate anxiety and emotional disturbances.
  5. Kidney 27 (KD27) – Shufu (Shu Mansion)
    • Location: Just below the collarbone, in the depression next to the breastbone.
    • Benefits: Supports the cardiovascular system, strengthens the chest, and promotes respiratory function.

How to Apply Acupressure for Heart Health

Applying acupressure to these points can be done in the comfort of your own home. Here’s a simple guide to get you started:

  1. Find the Right Spot: Use the descriptions above to locate each acupressure point. You can use your fingers to feel for slight indentations or sensitive areas.
  2. Apply Gentle Pressure: Use your thumb, fingers, or a soft-tipped tool to apply steady, firm pressure to the point. You should feel a slight discomfort but not pain.
  3. Hold and Breathe: Maintain the pressure for 1-3 minutes while taking deep, slow breaths. This helps to activate the point and allows the body to relax.
  4. Massage: In addition to holding the point, you can also gently massage the area in small circular motions to enhance the effects.

Benefits of Acupressure Points for Heart Health

The benefits of using acupressure points for heart health are multifaceted:

  1. Improved Circulation: Stimulating acupressure points helps improve blood flow, which is crucial for maintaining a healthy heart.
  2. Stress Reduction: Many acupressure points are effective in reducing stress and anxiety, which are major risk factors for heart disease.
  3. Emotional Balance: Acupressure can help balance emotions, reducing the risk of heart-related conditions exacerbated by emotional stress.
  4. Relief from Heart-Related Symptoms: Regular practice can alleviate symptoms like palpitations, chest pain, and shortness of breath.
  5. Holistic Healing: Acupressure promotes overall well-being by balancing the body’s energy, supporting not just the heart but the entire body.

Scientific Evidence Supporting Acupressure

While acupressure has been practiced for thousands of years, scientific research is beginning to catch up. Several studies have shown promising results:

  • A study published in the Journal of Acupuncture and Meridian Studies found that acupressure on PC6 significantly reduced heart rate and blood pressure in patients with hypertension.
  • Research in the American Journal of Chinese Medicine highlighted the positive effects of acupressure on reducing stress and anxiety levels, both of which are crucial for heart health.
  • A review in Evidence-Based Complementary and Alternative Medicine concluded that acupressure could be a beneficial complementary therapy for managing symptoms of heart disease.

Incorporating Acupressure into Your Routine

To maximize the benefits of acupressure points for heart health, consider incorporating it into your daily routine:

  1. Morning Routine: Start your day with a few minutes of acupressure to promote energy flow and reduce stress.
  2. Midday Break: Take a break from work or daily activities to apply acupressure, helping to alleviate any built-up stress.
  3. Evening Relaxation: Use acupressure before bed to calm the mind and promote restful sleep, which is vital for heart health.


Acupressure points for heart health offer a natural, non-invasive way to support your cardiovascular system. By incorporating this ancient practice into your daily routine, you can improve circulation, reduce stress, and promote overall well-being. Whether you’re looking to complement existing medical treatments or seeking preventive measures, acupressure provides a valuable tool for maintaining a healthy heart. Embrace the power of acupressure points for heart health and take a step towards a healthier, more balanced life. Your heart will thank you.
